eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom).

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom).
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct drift from previous shake

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.

Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change the type of the cursor
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: cursor_type

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Ahnaf30e
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Adds expressions to get the current FPS and a behavior to display the current FPS easily.

The FPS, Frames Per Second, describes how many times in the last second your game got updated. An update consists in running all the behaviors, objects, and events sheet code, before rendering the new game state into the game window. The higher the FPS, the more it manages to update in a second, influencing how fluid and performant your game looks.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FPS
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds expressions and a behavior to get and display the game FPS.

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count.
eventsFunctions.name: FPS

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count, with more control over rounding.
eventsFunctions.name: PreciseFPS

parameters.longDescription: This tells how many numbers after the period should be shown.
parameters.name: accuracy

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Makes a text object display the current FPS.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FPSDisplayer

propertyDescriptors.label: The prefix before the FPS count
propertyDescriptors.name: prefix

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object 
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object 
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)

Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).

Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Lizard-13
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
An action which, when applied on some objects, snap these objects to a *virtual grid*, with cells having customizable width and height.

Useful for level editors or putting objects on a tiled based map (RPG, strategy games, or any tiled based game in general).
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SnapToGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Action to snap objects to a virtual grid during the game.

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid (i.e: this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual grid using cells with  width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY
